archimate:Capability.name: Business Continuity
archimate:Capability.documentation:
This capability involves the development of an organization-wide business continuity strategy and program. It is characterized by the support of a resilient technical infrastructure and an effective crisis management capability. The strategy encompasses comprehensive planning and preparation to ensure that the organization can continue its critical operations in the event of a disruption, whether due to natural disasters, cyber-attacks, or other unforeseen events. The resilient technical infrastructure is designed to withstand various challenges and maintain functionality, while the crisis management capability ensures that the organization can respond effectively and efficiently to crises as they arise.
Additionally, the capability includes the development, maintenance, and regular testing of business continuity plans and arrangements, which may sometimes include disaster recovery plans. These plans are designed for critical business processes and applications throughout the organization, ensuring that each critical area has a tailored plan to address its specific needs and risks. Regular testing of these plans is crucial to identify any gaps or areas for improvement and to ensure that the plans remain effective and applicable in rapidly changing business and technological environments. This comprehensive approach to business continuity planning helps the organization to minimize the impact of disruptions on its operations and maintain its ability to deliver key services.
